Comedy based on the Disney theme-park ride, starring Eddie Murphy, Terence Stamp, Jennifer Tilly and Marsha Thomason.(n)

programme.title: Goal! The Dream Begins
programme.desc: A Mexican living in Los Angeles dreams of becoming a professional footballer - and his wish seems to come true when a talent scout offers him the chance to play for Newcastle United. Unfortunately, the pressures of the Premier League and adapting to a new life in Britain prove harder than expected. Drama, starring Kuno Becker and Anna Friel. David Beckham, Alan Shearer and Zinedine Zidane make cameo appearances.(n)

programme.title: The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas
programme.desc: Young courting couples Fred and Wilma, and Barney and Betty are invited to stay at a luxury casino in the Stone Age gambling capital. Owner Chip Rockefeller is bent on stopping Fred proposing to wealthy Wilma, because he wants to marry her himself for the money and settle his debts. Family comedy prequel, with Mark Addy, Stephen Baldwin, Joan Collins, Alan Cumming, Kristen Johnston and Jane Krakowski.(n)

programme.title: Ninja Assassin
programme.desc: An orphan is raised by a secret society of assassins and trained to be the ultimate killing machine, but he rebels when they kill his childhood friend. When a detective on the trail of the order is marked for death, the fugitive comes to her aid and protects her from his rival ninjas. Action thriller, starring Rain and Naomie Harris.

programme.title: The Krays
programme.desc: Biopic of the infamous twin brothers who built up a criminal empire in the East End of London during the 1960s. Seizing territory from an already established rival by force, they quickly rose to prominence in the city's gangland culture. However, over time the brothers began to clash, while enemies stood ready to bring them down. Starring Gary and Martin Kemp, Billie Whitelaw and Tom Bell.

programme.title: Point Last Seen
programme.desc: The head of a search and rescue team whose children were kidnapped by her ex-husband hunts obsessively for a girl gone missing in the desert. However, her search is interrupted by news that her spouse has been found - but the children he took are nowhere to be found. Fact-based drama, starring Linda Hamilton and Kevin Kilner.

programme.title: First Kill
programme.desc: A desperate father is blackmailed into helping a criminal gang evade a corrupt police chief. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Hayden Christensen and Ty Shelton.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck new recruit at an armoured truck company agrees to join his colleagues in a heist on one of their own vehicles, on the condition that no one gets hurt. However, when the plan starts to unravel and a witness is murdered, the thieves begin to turn on one another. Crime thriller, starring Matt Dillon, Columbus Short, Jean Reno and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.

programme.title: City of Tiny Lights
programme.desc: A hard-drinking private detective searches for a missing sex worker, leading to a dangerous world of religious fanaticism and political intrigue. London-set crime thriller from Dredd director Pete Travis, starring Riz Ahmed, Billie Piper and James Floyd.

programme.title: The Infiltrator
programme.desc: During the 1980s, a chameleonic US agent faces one of the most dangerous assignments of his life when he infiltrates the intricate criminal network of drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. Drama, starring Bryan Cranston, John Leguizamo and Diane Kruger.

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Twentysomething gun runners David Packouz and Efraim Diveroli win a $300million contract from the Pentagon to arm America's allies in Afghanistan. Fact based comedy-drama, starring Miles Teller, Jonah Hill and Bradley Cooper.

programme.title: Armored
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck new recruit at an armoured truck company agrees to join his colleagues in a heist on one of their own vehicles, on the condition that no one gets hurt. However, when the plan starts to unravel and a witness is murdered, the thieves begin to turn on one another. Crime thriller, starring Matt Dillon, Columbus Short, Jean Reno and Laurence Fishburne.

programme.title: The Sting
programme.desc: Two conmen decide to swindle a mobster out of a fortune in revenge for the murder of a mutual friend. Enlisting the help of a host of crooks, they quickly conjure up a brilliant scheme to make him pay for his crime. Oscar-winning Depression-era comedy drama, starring Robert Redford, Paul Newman, Robert Shaw, Charles Durning and Eileen Brennan.

programme.title: The Juror
programme.desc: A mobster threatens to have a juror's son murdered if she fails to persuade the other 11 members of the jury to return a verdict of not guilty in the trial of a Mafia kingpin. Psychological thriller, starring Demi Moore, Alec Baldwin, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, James Gandolfini and Anne Heche.

programme.title: Rise Of The Footsoldier 3
programme.desc: Notorious gangster Pat Tate rises through the ranks of Essex's criminal underworld. Prequel, starring Craig Fairbrass, Terry Stone and Roland Manookian.(n)

programme.title: Drone
programme.desc: A drone pilot who's spent his career conducting covert operations from the comfort of his own home is finally forced to confront his actions. Thriller, starring Sean Bean, Patrick Sabongui and Mary McCormack.(n)

programme.title: Sam Churchill: Search for a Homeless Man
programme.desc: A seemingly straightforward missing persons case draws a private investigator into a battle against the members of a child pornography ring, who are holding a teenager he has been hired to find. Thriller, starring John Schneider, Robyn Lively, Alex Rocco and Rudy Ramos.(n)

programme.title: Goldstone
programme.desc: A hard-drinking Australian detective uncovers a web of corruption while on the trail of a missing tourist. Thriller, starring Aaron Pedersen, Alex Russell and Jacki Weaver.(n)

programme.title: Phone Booth
programme.desc: A smart-mouthed PR executive answers a public phone and the caller on the other end warns him that if he hangs up he will be shot. The unseen gunman then puts his target through a tortuous series of mind games, as well as incriminating him in the death of a bystander. Psychological thriller, starring Colin Farrell, Kiefer Sutherland, Katie Holmes and Forest Whitaker.(n)

programme.title: Mine
programme.desc: Following a failed assassination attempt, a soldier is stranded in the desert where he must survive the elements and stay sane enough to survive. Thriller, starring Armie Hammer, Annabelle Wallis and Tom Cullen.(n)

programme.title: Dick Tracy
programme.desc: An incorruptible Chicago cop launches a relentless campaign to stop a ruthless gangster plotting to take control of the city. But the detective finds himself distracted by the attentions of a seductive nightclub singer and a faceless vigilante playing both sides against the middle. Comic-strip adventure, directed by and starring Warren Beatty, with Madonna, Al Pacino and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: B&B
programme.desc: A gay couple plan for a weekend of mischief, winding up the Christian owner of a remote Christian B&B. Events take a sinister turn when another guest arrives, who they think might have something more deadly in mind. Thriller, starring Tom Bateman, Sean Teale and Paul McGann.(n)

programme.title: Numb
programme.desc: An impoverished couple discover GPS coordinates that promise to lead to stolen gold. They team up with a pair of mysterious hitchhikers to recover the coins from a wintry wilderness. Thriller, starring Jamie Bamber, Marie Avgeropoulos, Aleks Paunovic and Stefanie Von Pfetten.(n)

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: When a scheming Italian crime lord holds him to a blood oath, reluctant hitman John Wick goes on another murderous rampage. Action sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Riccardo Scamarcio and Ian McShane.(n)

programme.title: The Taking of Pelham 123
programme.desc: Criminals hijack a crowded New York subway train and threaten to start shooting the passengers unless a $10million ransom is paid in one hour. However, the transport supervisor they issue their demands to begins to suspect the plot is part of an even grander scheme. Tony Scott's thriller remake, with Denzel Washington and John Travolta.(n)

programme.title: Brawl In Cell Block 99
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson.(n)

programme.title: B&B
programme.desc: A gay couple plan for a weekend of mischief, winding up the Christian owner of a remote Christian B&B. Events take a sinister turn when another guest arrives, who they think might have something more deadly in mind. Thriller, starring Tom Bateman, Sean Teale and Paul McGann.(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: Two tough New York cops use unorthodox methods to try to break an international drug ring. When their information leads them to place a candy store under surveillance, they discover the owners are the American agents for a French kingpin planning to ship millions of dollars worth of heroin into the US. Oscar-winning fact-based thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Roy Scheider, Fernando Rey and Tony Lo Bianco.(n)

programme.title: The Resident
programme.desc: Left alone to care for her baby in a creepy apartment, a new mother begins to learn unsettling details about the building's violent past. Psychological horror-thriller, starring Tianna Nori, Mark Matechuk and Krista Madison.(n)

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.(n)

programme.title: Escobar: Paradise Lost
programme.desc: A Canadian surfer on holiday in Colombia falls in love with a local girl, only to discover to his horror that her uncle is the notorious drug kingpin Pablo Escobar. He finds himself forced to become part of Escobar's family business, putting his life on the line as he faces the dangerous reality of the international cocaine trade. Thriller, starring Benicio Del Toro and Josh Hutcherson.(n)

programme.title: Morgan
programme.desc: A corporate risk-management consultant decides whether or not to destroy an artificially created humanoid. Sci-fi thriller, starring Kate Mara, Anya Taylor-Joy and Rose Leslie.(n)

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: FBI agent Gretchen Blair finds herself caught in the middle of an elaborate mid-air heist. Thriller, starring Denise Richards, Dolph Lundgren and Chuck Liddell.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle.(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean rounds up his band of crooks for one last heist. Gang member Reuben has been left traumatised and in a coma after being double-crossed by crooked casino owner Willy Bank, and Danny decides that payback is in order. He plans a scheme that will leave Bank penniless, but needs the help of an old enemy. Comedy crime caper sequel, with George Clooney, Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Elliott Gould.(n)

programme.title: Blood Father
programme.desc: An ex-con battles to protect his estranged daughter from the cronies of her cartel member ex. Action thriller, starring Mel Gibson, Erin Moriarty and Diego Luna.(n)

programme.title: The Snowman
programme.desc: Detective Harry Hole investigates the disappearance of a woman whose scarf is found wrapped around an ominous-looking snowman. Crime drama based on the Jo Nesbo novel, starring Michael Fassbender, Rebecca Ferguson and Charlotte Gainsbourg.(n)

programme.title: Panic Room
programme.desc: A single mother is determined to keep her daughter safe from harm when burglars break into their home. The pair hide out in a specially constructed sealed room, but the shelter becomes a prison when the robbers refuse to leave empty-handed. Thriller directed by David Fincher, starring Jodie Foster, Kristen Stewart, Forest Whitaker, Jared Leto and Dwight Yoakam.(n)

programme.title: The Accused
programme.desc: A down-at-heel waitress vows to bring to justice the gang who raped her in a small-town bar - but is shocked when her attackers are given a light sentence. Determined not to be beaten, she persuades the district attorney to prosecute the men who watched the attack but did nothing to stop it. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jodie Foster, with Kelly McGillis, Bernie Coulson, Leo Rossi and Woody Brown.(n)

programme.title: Zero Dark Thirty
programme.desc: A CIA operative joins a team of intelligence and military operatives in the aftermath of the September 11 attacks. She spends the next 10 years searching for information on the whereabouts of Osama bin Laden, ultimately leading to the final raid on the terrorist leader's hideout. Kathryn Bigelow's fact-based drama, starring Jessica Chastain and Mark Strong.

programme.title: Pursued
programme.desc: A brooding cowboy yearns to find peace, but his life seems to follow a tragic path because of the actions and hatred of a mysterious one-armed stranger and a forgotten incident from his childhood. Western, starring Robert Mitchum, Teresa Wright, Dean Jagger, Judith Anderson, Alan Hale and John Rodney.

programme.title: Flying Tigers
programme.desc: An American pilot leads a squadron of volunteer aviators to help China's fledgling air force fight the Japanese during the Second World War. However, he has to contend with the consequences when the actions of an arrogant hotshot pilot lead to the death of a fellow veteran airman. Drama, starring John Wayne, John Carroll, Anna Lee and Paul Kelly.

programme.title: Dakota
programme.desc: A professional gambler and a railway tycoon's daughter elope, hoping to make their fortune by buying land in Dakota. However, they instead find themselves helping the local farmers defend their homes against unscrupulous businessmen trying to drive them off their land. Western, starring John Wayne and Vera Hruba Ralston.

programme.title: Juggernaut
programme.desc: A transatlantic liner and its 1,200 passengers are threatened by a bomber, forcing a team of demolition experts into a desperate race against time to avert a catastrophe. Thriller, starring Richard Harris, Anthony Hopkins, Omar Sharif, Ian Holm and David Hemmings.

programme.title: Tomorrow, When the War Began
programme.desc: Seven Australian teenagers return from a camping trip in the wilderness to find that while away, their country has been invaded by a hostile foreign power and their families sent to prison camps. They form a resistance group to fight a guerrilla campaign against the occupying forces. Action adventure, starring Caitlin Stasey, Rachel Hurd-Wood and Lincoln Lewis.

programme.title: Die Hard 4.0
programme.desc: Tough New York cop John McClane is sent to escort a computer hacker to Washington for questioning. During this routine operation he stumbles on a criminal mastermind's plan to launch a technological terrorist attack on the US, and is forced to enlist the hacker's aid in foiling the evil scheme. Action thriller sequel, with Bruce Willis, Timothy Olyphant, Justin Long and Maggie Q.

programme.title: Man on Fire
programme.desc: A former US government operative battling with alcoholism is hired as a bodyguard to the daughter of a wealthy businessman in Mexico City - but when the girl is abducted, he swears to exact an explosive revenge on the kidnappers. Action thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Christopher Walken, Radha Mitchell and Dakota Fanning.

programme.title: Aaaaaaaah
programme.desc: In a strange parallel world, humans have developed all the trappings of modern civilisation, but have no language and still behave like apes. An alpha male, aided by his sidekick, tries to assert his dominance over a community. Comedy horror, directed by and starring Steve Oram, with Tom Meeten and Julian Rhind-Tutt.(n)

programme.title: The Mark of Zorro
programme.desc: An aristocratic 19th-century swordsman returns to his native California from Spain to find the people living under the rule of a cruel tyrant. He adopts the guise of a masked avenger, fighting to protect the poor and downtrodden, while playing the foppish nobleman in his day-to-day life to avoid suspicion. Swashbuckling adventure, with Tyrone Power and Basil Rathbone.(n)

programme.title: Pimpernel Smith
programme.desc: An unassuming English professor working on an archaeological dig in Germany leads a double life helping enemies of the Nazi regime escape the country. Second World War adventure based on The Scarlet Pimpernel, directed by and starring Leslie Howard, with Francis L Sullivan, Mary Morris, Hugh McDermott, Raymond Huntley and Manning Whiley.(n)

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older man's trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Regardless
programme.desc: A businessman starts up an odd-job agency, but employs seven hopeless handymen incapable of completing any task without causing utter chaos. Matters come to a head when their landlord tries to evict them - forcing the bungling workmen to finally prove their worth. Slapstick comedy, starring Sid James, Charles Hawtrey and Kenneth Williams.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future
programme.desc: Teenager Marty McFly travels back to the 1950s in a time machine built by his eccentric inventor friend. The return journey proves tricky enough, but he also accidentally alters the sequence of events that led to his parents falling in love - and has to persuade his future dad to win his mother's heart, or he will never be born. Sci-fi comedy adventure, starring Michael J Fox, Christopher Lloyd, Lea Thompson and Crispin Glover.(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A convicted child-killer of towering height and massive build is condemned to death row, but astonishes the guards with his good nature and miraculous healing powers. They believe the gentle giant is incapable of crime, and emotions run high as they realise there is no hope of overturning his death sentence. Supernatural drama, based on a novel by Stephen King, starring Tom Hanks, Michael Clarke Duncan, David Morse and Harry Dean Stanton.(n)

programme.title: Citadel
programme.desc: A man is left with severe agoraphobia after his pregnant wife is attacked by a vicious gang, leaving him to raise their baby alone in a rundown block of flats. A priest warns him that the thugs responsible for his plight will return for the infant, and the only way to save her is to take a stand against them on their own territory. Horror, starring Aneurin Barnard and James Cosmo.(n)

programme.title: The Bay
programme.desc: A reporter survives an ecological catastrophe that struck a coastal town, killing hundreds of people in just 24 hours. The authorities have covered up the cause of the disaster, so she gathers together all the video footage in existence from that fateful day on a mission to expose the truth. Thriller, starring Kether Donohue and Kristen Connolly.(n)

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes: Terror By Night
programme.desc: The legendary sleuth and his faithful sidekick Dr Watson hunt for the killer of an aristocrat who hired them to keep a priceless diamond out of the hands of thieves. Mystery, starring Basil Rathbone, Nigel Bruce, Alan Mowbray, Dennis Hoey and Mary Forbes.(n)

programme.title: Sorry, Wrong Number
programme.desc: Rich, neurotic Leona Stevenson lies bedridden at home and is trying to phone her husband. But the lines are crossed, and she accidentally overhears a call in which two men are planning a murder. She frantically tries to raise the alarm, and when at last she manages to convince the telephone company of her story, she comes to realise with increasing horror who their intended victim is. Thriller, starring Barbara Stanwyck, Burt Lancaster, Ann Richards and Wendell Corey.(n)

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.(n)

programme.title: Operation Petticoat
programme.desc: A Second World War submarine captain tries to restore his crippled vessel to its former glory, but is thwarted by his first officer, who has invited a party of nurses, children and an expectant mother on board. Mayhem ensues as the skipper struggles to rein in the female influence on ship protocol. Comedy, starring Cary Grant, Tony Curtis and Joan O'Brien.(n)

programme.title: Back to the Future Part II
programme.desc: Time-travelling teenager Marty McFly travels to the 21st century, where he has to save his children from a terrible fate. However, this proves to have unforeseen consequences when the future version of arch enemy Biff sees a chance to rewrite history for his own benefit, leaving Marty stuck in a twisted parallel universe. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Michael J Fox and Christopher Lloyd.(n)

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton.(n)

programme.title: Candyman
programme.desc: Virginia Madsen stars as a student researching urban legends for her dissertation, who investigates the tale of a supernatural, hook-handed serial killer rumoured to haunt a run-down Chicago apartment block. Though cynical at first, she soon finds herself face to face with the phantom, who sets his sights on claiming her as his latest victim. Horror, with Tony Todd, Xander Berkeley and Vanessa Williams.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's dean asks him to take care of a 16-year-old genius college student for a weekend. The apparent genius is clearly gifted in all academic areas, but woefully lacking in social graces. Richard Thomas stars.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A boxer comes to work on the mountain, hoping to raise the money to build a church. However, when he gets the chance to enter a match, he learns it is rigged.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Trying to start a new life after Alice's death, Jonathan and his son Andy move to Sleepy Eye to establish a freight business.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A former football star agrees to take on the role of the town's team coach, but the squad reacts poorly to his tough brand of leadership.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Jim returns home to recover from his injuries, leaving Syd, Joanie and Robbie to clash over each other's reactions to the changes in their father.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd struggles to reconcile a patient with his estranged father, and Robbie busies himself with DIY projects at Tina's apartment. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark pose as priests so they can re-open an abandoned church as shelter for people who have lost their homes in a fire. Guest starring Didi Conn (Grease).

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark's latest assignment is Wally, a lovable elderly hobo and street puppeteer whose caring and good nature have made him, without him knowing, into an angel. Dick Van Dyke guest stars.

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Everything to Gain
programme.desc: A woman sinks into a deep depression following the murder of her husband and two children, but the love of a mysterious man brings hope into the grieving widow's life. Drama, starring Sean Young, Jack Scalia and Anne Ramsey.

programme.title: The Bling Ring
programme.desc: Five teenagers united by an obsession with celebrity steal from the houses of the rich and famous stars they idolise, using the internet to follow their targets' movements. When the police finally catch up with them, the arrest brings a taste of the fame they have craved. Fact-based drama, starring Emma Watson and Israel Broussard.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A newcomer arrives in town looking for a job and a place to stay, but suspicions are raised that he may be a German spy.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Caleb Hodgekiss comes up with a way to scam the residents of Walnut Grove after rescuing a seriously ill Rev Alden from his runaway wagon. Johnny Cash guest stars.

programme.title: Criminal Instinct: A Colder Kind of Death
programme.desc: A former detective reinvestigates the unsolved murder of her husband, who was killed six years previously, only to find herself accused of killing the police's prime suspect. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson, Victor Garber and Robin Dunne.

programme.title: Deadly Appearances
programme.desc: An up-and-coming politician is implicated in the murder of a student, police believe he is being blackmailed but when he turns up dead the quest for the truth unearths shocking secrets from his past. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson, Victor Garber and Robert Hays.

programme.title: Ike: The War Years
programme.desc: Part one of three. Biopic of Dwight D Eisenhower following his path up the army ranks to commander of Allied forces in the Second World War and US president. Starring Robert Duvall.

programme.title: Survive the Savage Sea
programme.desc: A family sells a farm, buys a yacht and sets sail for a new life in Australia - but an unscheduled encounter with a whale plunges the journey into chaos. Fact-based drama, starring Robert Urich, Ali MacGraw and Danielle Von Zerneck.

programme.title: Prophet's Prey
programme.desc: Documentary about former Mormon fundamentalist leader Warren Jeffs, who held a dictatorial rule over his followers before being convicted of sexual assault on children.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John is nervous about attending a high-school reunion, feeling that his friends have all achieved more than he has.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy shows a reporter writing a guide book around the community, but John worries about what he might uncover.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: An old man takes in two orphans running from care workers who have decided they stand a better chance of finding a family if they are split up and offered for adoption separately.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Annie Crane's mother finally tracks her daughter down and sparks begin to fly, until Caroline intervenes.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney becomes better acquainted with Joe's estranged wife Erica - leading to conflict between the couple.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney contemplates moving to Washington with Joe when his campaign trail leaves her feeling vulnerable and alone.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Gabe Wilson, an old friend of Mark's, tries to re-build his life after suffering a heart attack. He is reunited with his old flame, but finds out that the woman he once loved has changed.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of two teenagers, and help them resolve their confidence issues concerning height before their senior prom.(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Love in Another Town
programme.desc: Abandoned by her husband, Maggie reinvents her life and moves to a new community. Before long, she meets younger man Jake, who unbeknown to her has endured the same rejection. Romantic drama, starring Victoria Principal and Adrian Pasdar.(n)

programme.title: Demons from Her Past
programme.desc: An innocent woman spends 25 years behind bars for the murder of a child she did not commit. Once released, she returns to her home town to track down the real killers, who will go to any lengths to keep their guilty secret buried. Crime drama, starring Alexandra Paul and Michael Woods.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob and Ben are consumed with jealousy as each would rather be with the other's girlfriend. Mamie Baldwin realises she may not have long left to live.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie Oleson is seriously injured after falling from a horse that used to belong to Laura Ingalls, and her mother blames the steed's former owner for the accident.(n)

programme.title: Aftermath: A Test of Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, following a violent robbery in which a teenager was left horrifically injured and her mother killed. The film focuses on the wounded girl's emotionally detached father, who struggles to hold the family and his own sanity together. Starring Richard Chamberlain and Michael Learned.(n)

programme.title: The Wandering Soul Murders
programme.desc: A woman's slaughter leads police to the assumption that a killer is stalking prostitutes. However, as the investigation proceeds, it becomes clear that an even darker force is at work. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson and Victor Garber.(n)

programme.title: Ike: The War Years
programme.desc: Part two of three. Biopic of Dwight D Eisenhower following his path up the army ranks to commander of Allied forces in the Second World War and US president. Starring Robert Duvall.(n)

programme.title: Restless Virgins
programme.desc: A biographical drama based upon the ex scandal that shook Massachusetts prep school, Milton Academy in 2004-05 school year. Drama, starring Vanessa Marano, Max Lloyd-Jones and Charlie Carver.(n)

programme.title: Daddy's Girl
programme.desc: A landscape gardener finally finds new romance 10 years after his wife walked out - but as a result, his teenage daughter begins to suffer recurring nightmares about the night her mum disappeared. Turning to the police for help, she claims a murder has taken place, and a full investigation into the case begins - but suspicions remain that she is merely manipulating her dad. Drama, starring Martin Kemp.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason spends too much time playing with a band. His school work, music lessons, and health begin to suffer. Meanwhile, John-Boy gets a part-time job in a library, and the librarian soon suggests he consider it as a profession.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: After having a domestic squabble, Laura suspects that Almanzo is having an affair with a former girlfriend and decides to leave him and move back to her parents' home.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Albert begins writing to a pen pal in another city, but cannot understand why she seems so reluctant to meet him.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney decides whether to continue her romance with Joe Connelly, little Pete sets his bedroom on fire, and as election day draws near, Syd begins to question Joe's integrity.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Chaos abounds as Robbie and Tina prepare to tie the knot, prompting Hannah to play Cupid for Joanie.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan is given the chance to return to Heaven if he completes one last assignment - persuading a film star's bitter daughter not to publish a scathing article about her mother.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help out at a home for former patients in a mental hospital who have been released before their treatment was complete.(n)

programme.title: Gossip
programme.desc: After emerging from a bitter divorce battle, single mother Joanna returns to the sleepy home town she could not wait to flee as a teenager. As she sets about rekindling old friendships, Joanna finds herself falling in love with an old flame. However, the man is married, and the pair's affair threatens to rock the community. Romantic drama, starring Kelli Williams and Kristen Holden-Ried.(n)

programme.title: Ungodly Acts
programme.desc: Police investigate the fanatical leader of a religious cult at the centre of a murder case. When a young woman is found dead, a man confesses to her murder, but admits a controlling cult leader forced him to commit the crime. Drama, starring Megan Park and Brant Daugherty.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason works with a black boy on an act for the spring festival, but is shocked by the racial prejudice he encounters. Elizabeth has a crush on a new boy in her class.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura and her horse Bunny are favoured to win the upcoming race in Walnut Grove - however, Mrs Oleson believes the victory should go to Nellie. To guarantee her success she purchases a thoroughbred and provides the trophy.(n)

programme.title: Proof of Lies
programme.desc: A dedicated scientist carrying out research into the genetic cause of addictive behaviour seems on the verge of a ground-breaking discovery - until a break-in at her lab makes her suspect she has become caught up in a conspiracy motivated by greed. Thriller, starring Amanda Detmer, Jonathan Scarfe and Anthony Lemke.(n)

programme.title: Confined
programme.desc: A woman moves to a new neighbourhood with her husband after she suffers a breakdown. She becomes suspicious of the man living next door, and starts to believe he is keeping someone locked in his basement. However, when she tries to tell her husband, he assumes her mental problems have returned. Thriller, starring Emma Caulfield and Michael Hogan.(n)

programme.title: Ike: The War Years
programme.desc: Part three of three. Biopic of Dwight D Eisenhower following his path up the army ranks to commander of Allied forces in the Second World War and US president. With Robert Duvall.(n)

programme.title: The Bunker
programme.desc: In the last weeks of the Second World War, Adolf Hitler's empire crumbles around him, so he and his inner circle seek refuge in a Berlin bunker from the approaching allied forces. Drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Richard Jordan and Cliff Gorman.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Instinct: A Colder Kind of Death
programme.desc: A former detective reinvestigates the unsolved murder of her husband, who was killed six years previously, only to find herself accused of killing the police's prime suspect. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson, Victor Garber and Robin Dunne.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A boxer comes to work on the mountain, hoping to raise the money to build a church. However, when he gets the chance to enter a match, he learns it is rigged.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Trying to start a new life after Alice's death, Jonathan and his son Andy move to Sleepy Eye to establish a freight business.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark pose as priests so they can re-open an abandoned church as shelter for people who have lost their homes in a fire. Guest starring Didi Conn (Grease).

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark's latest assignment is Wally, a lovable elderly hobo and street puppeteer whose caring and good nature have made him, without him knowing, into an angel. Dick Van Dyke guest stars.

programme.desc: A woman sinks into a deep depression following the murder of her husband and two children, but the love of a mysterious man brings hope into the grieving widow's life. Drama, starring Sean Young, Jack Scalia and Anne Ramsey.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A newcomer arrives in town looking for a job and a place to stay, but suspicions are raised that he may be a German spy.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie

programme.title: Criminal Instinct: A Colder Kind of Death
programme.desc: A former detective reinvestigates the unsolved murder of her husband, who was killed six years previously, only to find herself accused of killing the police's prime suspect. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson, Victor Garber and Robin Dunne.

programme.desc: An up-and-coming politician is implicated in the murder of a student, police believe he is being blackmailed but when he turns up dead the quest for the truth unearths shocking secrets from his past. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson, Victor Garber and Robert Hays.

programme.title: Ike: The War Years

programme.desc: Documentary about former Mormon fundamentalist leader Warren Jeffs, who held a dictatorial rule over his followers before being convicted of sexual assault on children.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: An old man takes in two orphans running from care workers who have decided they stand a better chance of finding a family if they are split up and offered for adoption separately.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Annie Crane's mother finally tracks her daughter down and sparks begin to fly, until Caroline intervenes.(n)

programme.title: Providence

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney contemplates moving to Washington with Joe when his campaign trail leaves her feeling vulnerable and alone.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Gabe Wilson, an old friend of Mark's, tries to re-build his life after suffering a heart attack. He is reunited with his old flame, but finds out that the woman he once loved has changed.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark come to the aid of two teenagers, and help them resolve their confidence issues concerning height before their senior prom.(n)

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's Love in Another Town
programme.desc: Abandoned by her husband, Maggie reinvents her life and moves to a new community. Before long, she meets younger man Jake, who unbeknown to her has endured the same rejection. Romantic drama, starring Victoria Principal and Adrian Pasdar.(n)

programme.title: Demons from Her Past
programme.desc: An innocent woman spends 25 years behind bars for the murder of a child she did not commit. Once released, she returns to her home town to track down the real killers, who will go to any lengths to keep their guilty secret buried. Crime drama, starring Alexandra Paul and Michael Woods.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob and Ben are consumed with jealousy as each would rather be with the other's girlfriend. Mamie Baldwin realises she may not have long left to live.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie Oleson is seriously injured after falling from a horse that used to belong to Laura Ingalls, and her mother blames the steed's former owner for the accident.(n)

programme.title: Aftermath: A Test of Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, following a violent robbery in which a teenager was left horrifically injured and her mother killed. The film focuses on the wounded girl's emotionally detached father, who struggles to hold the family and his own sanity together. Starring Richard Chamberlain and Michael Learned.(n)

programme.title: The Wandering Soul Murders
programme.desc: A woman's slaughter leads police to the assumption that a killer is stalking prostitutes. However, as the investigation proceeds, it becomes clear that an even darker force is at work. Thriller, starring Wendy Crewson and Victor Garber.(n)

programme.desc: A biographical drama based upon the ex scandal that shook Massachusetts prep school, Milton Academy in 2004-05 school year. Drama, starring Vanessa Marano, Max Lloyd-Jones and Charlie Carver.(n)

programme.desc: A landscape gardener finally finds new romance 10 years after his wife walked out - but as a result, his teenage daughter begins to suffer recurring nightmares about the night her mum disappeared. Turning to the police for help, she claims a murder has taken place, and a full investigation into the case begins - but suspicions remain that she is merely manipulating her dad. Drama, starring Martin Kemp.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason spends too much time playing with a band. His school work, music lessons, and health begin to suffer. Meanwhile, John-Boy gets a part-time job in a library, and the librarian soon suggests he consider it as a profession.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy writes an article about a woman who performs wing walking stunts, whom Jim-Bob falls for. However, she mistakenly thinks John-Boy is her secret admirer. Maude Gormley gives her goat to the family in return for a rocking chair.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: After having a domestic squabble, Laura suspects that Almanzo is having an affair with a former girlfriend and decides to leave him and move back to her parents' home.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Albert begins writing to a pen pal in another city, but cannot understand why she seems so reluctant to meet him.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Sydney decides whether to continue her romance with Joe Connelly, little Pete sets his bedroom on fire, and as election day draws near, Syd begins to question Joe's integrity.(n)

programme.desc: Chaos abounds as Robbie and Tina prepare to tie the knot, prompting Hannah to play Cupid for Joanie.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan is given the chance to return to Heaven if he completes one last assignment - persuading a film star's bitter daughter not to publish a scathing article about her mother.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark help out at a home for former patients in a mental hospital who have been released before their treatment was complete.(n)

programme.title: Gossip
programme.desc: After emerging from a bitter divorce battle, single mother Joanna returns to the sleepy home town she could not wait to flee as a teenager. As she sets about rekindling old friendships, Joanna finds herself falling in love with an old flame. However, the man is married, and the pair's affair threatens to rock the community. Romantic drama, starring Kelli Williams and Kristen Holden-Ried.(n)

programme.title: Ungodly Acts
programme.desc: Police investigate the fanatical leader of a religious cult at the centre of a murder case. When a young woman is found dead, a man confesses to her murder, but admits a controlling cult leader forced him to commit the crime. Drama, starring Megan Park and Brant Daugherty.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason works with a black boy on an act for the spring festival, but is shocked by the racial prejudice he encounters. Elizabeth has a crush on a new boy in her class.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura and her horse Bunny are favoured to win the upcoming race in Walnut Grove - however, Mrs Oleson believes the victory should go to Nellie. To guarantee her success she purchases a thoroughbred and provides the trophy.(n)

programme.title: Proof of Lies
programme.desc: A dedicated scientist carrying out research into the genetic cause of addictive behaviour seems on the verge of a ground-breaking discovery - until a break-in at her lab makes her suspect she has become caught up in a conspiracy motivated by greed. Thriller, starring Amanda Detmer, Jonathan Scarfe and Anthony Lemke.(n)

programme.title: Confined
programme.desc: A woman moves to a new neighbourhood with her husband after she suffers a breakdown. She becomes suspicious of the man living next door, and starts to believe he is keeping someone locked in his basement. However, when she tries to tell her husband, he assumes her mental problems have returned. Thriller, starring Emma Caulfield and Michael Hogan.(n)

programme.title: Ike: The War Years
programme.desc: Part three of three. Biopic of Dwight D Eisenhower following his path up the army ranks to commander of Allied forces in the Second World War and US president. With Robert Duvall.(n)

programme.title: The Bunker
programme.desc: In the last weeks of the Second World War, Adolf Hitler's empire crumbles around him, so he and his inner circle seek refuge in a Berlin bunker from the approaching allied forces. Drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Richard Jordan and Cliff Gorman.(n)

programme.title: Who Is America?: 101
programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.

programme.title: Russia Investigation
programme.desc: Our Cartoon President tries to survive the Russia investigation with Steve Mnuchin's help while Nancy Pelosi and Chuck Schumer fire up Democrats with a new message.(c)

programme.title: Inglourious Basterds
programme.desc: A squadron of vengeful, Nazi-killing Allied soldiers becomes embroiled in a plot to firebomb a Parisian movie theater hosting a film premiere that Adolf Hitler plans to attend in this comically violent World War II action smash starring Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger and Oscar® winner Christoph Waltz.

programme.title: Who Is America?: 101
programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.

programme.title: American Satan
programme.desc: Hellbent on following in the footsteps of their music idols, a young rock band moves to Los Angeles to chase their dreams of stardom on the Sunset Strip. When they meet an enigmatic stranger who seems to know them better than they know themselves, he preys on their most basic desires and emotions. He entices them with an offer that sets them on a path to fame and fortune. But when their debut album, AMERICAN SATAN, is released, it sets off a firestorm of controversy, death, and destruction beyond anything the music world could ever imagine.

programme.title: Alive
programme.desc: Stranded after a plane crash in the Andes mountains, individual members of Uruguay's rugby team respond differently. Group leader Nando (Ethan Hawke) tries to keep everyone's spirits up; medical student Roberto (Josh Hamilton) diligently treats cases of frostbite and gangrene; loose cannon Antonio (Vincent Spano) gradually loses his composure. Once all available food runs out, the group faces a terrible dilemma: eat one or more of their deceased teammates, or die.

programme.title: ATM
programme.desc: After leaving a party together, coworkers David (Brian Geraghty), Emily (Alice Eve) and Corey (Josh Peck) stop at an ATM. Pulling into a desolate parking lot, Corey gets out to get cash and a routine transaction turns into a struggle for survival when an unknown man appears outside blocking their exit. With the wintry temperatures dipping below freezing, and the morning sunrise still hours away, they have no choice but to play the man's deadly game of cat-and-mouse.

programme.title: 7 Guardians of the Tomb
programme.desc: A team of scientists made up of Jia (Li Bingbing), Ridley (Kellan Lutz), and Mason (Kelsey Grammer) are in search for a lost colleague in an ancient labyrinth. Before it's too late, the group must battle their way through a swarm of deadly, man-eating funnel web spiders and find out what is behind the arachnids' power and intelligence used to protect a secret powerful elixir.

programme.title: The Promise
programme.desc: Brilliant medical student Michael (Oscar Isaac) meets beautiful dance instructor Ana (Charlotte Le Bon) in late 1914. Their shared Armenian heritage sparks an attraction that turns into a romantic rivalry between Michael and Ana's boyfriend (Christian Bale), an American photojournalist. As the Ottoman Empire crumbles into war-torn chaos, their conflicting passions must be put aside as they join forces to get themselves to safety.

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.

programme.title: Man On A Ledge
programme.desc: When former NYPD officer turned prison escapee Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) enters the famed Roosevelt Hotel on 45th and Madison in New York City, heads to one of the highest floors and steps out a window onto the ledge, he threatens more than just his own well-being. A whole city is about to seize up, including some very nervous people with some very big secrets. Elizabeth Banks, Ed Harris and Edward Burns co-star in this propulsive, twisty action thriller.

programme.title: King Arthur
programme.desc: An adventure that tells the true story of Arthur (Clive Owen) and his bond of brotherhood with Lancelot (Ioan Gruffudd) and the Knights Of The Round Table as they fight for freedom and those they love. Co-starring Keira Knightley.

programme.title: The Rock
programme.desc: All of San Francisco is taken hostage when a vengeful general (Ed Harris) seizes control of Alcatraz Island, threatening to launch missiles loaded with deadly poison gas. With time running out, only a young FBI chemical weapons expert (Nicolas Cage) and a notorious federal prisoner (Sean Connery) have the skills to penetrate the island fortress and defuse the situation.

programme.title: Who Is America?: 101
programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.(n)

programme.title: The Debt
programme.desc: Academy Award winner Helen Mirren and Sam Worthington star in the story of Rachel Singer (Mirren), a former Mossad agent who endeavored to capture and bring to trial a notorious Nazi war criminal in a secret Israeli mission that ended with his death on the streets of East Berlin. Now, 30 years later, a man claiming to be the doctor has surfaced, and Rachel must go back to Eastern Europe to uncover the truth. Directed by Academy Award nominee John Madden.(n)

programme.title: Who Is America?: 101
programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.(n)

programme.title: Man On A Ledge
programme.desc: When former NYPD officer turned prison escapee Nick Cassidy (Sam Worthington) enters the famed Roosevelt Hotel on 45th and Madison in New York City, heads to one of the highest floors and steps out a window onto the ledge, he threatens more than just his own well-being. A whole city is about to seize up, including some very nervous people with some very big secrets. Elizabeth Banks, Ed Harris and Edward Burns co-star in this propulsive, twisty action thriller.(n)

programme.title: Brimstone
programme.desc: Liz (Dakota Fanning) is full of heart and grit but is being hunted by a vengeful Preacher (Guy Pearce) who is a diabolical zealot. She's a genuine survivor and uses her strength to claim the better life she and her daughter deserve.(n)

programme.title: The Rendezvous
programme.desc: Rachel, a Jewish-American doctor and Jake, an Arab-American government bureaucrat, are trying to solve the mysterious death of Rachel's brother. Racing around the world, they find themselves hunted by a doomsday group. The group believes Rachel and Jake possess an ancient script discovered by Rachel's brother that could bring about the end of days. Caught in the middle of a plot to hasten the end of mankind, Rachel and Jake must solve a murder and save the world.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Cocktail
programme.desc: Tom Cruise is Brian Flanagan, a young, confident and ambitious bartender who, with the help of a seasoned pro (Bryan Brown), becomes the toast of Manhattan's Upper East Side. But when he moves to Jamaica and meets an independent artist (Elisabeth Shue), their vivid romance brings a new perspective to the self-centered bartender's life.(n)

programme.title: Margin Call
programme.desc: Set in the high-stakes world of the ﬁnancial industry, this film follows the key players at an investment ﬁrm during a 24-hour period in the early stages of the 2008 ﬁnancial crisis. When an entry-level analyst unlocks information that could prove to be the downfall of the ﬁrm, a roller-coaster ride ensues as decisions both ﬁnancial and moral catapult the lives of all involved into mayhem.(n)

programme.title: Love Means Zero
programme.desc: At 85 years old, Nick Bollettieri is a living legend. At his tennis academy in Florida, he raised a generation of champions. Courier. Seles. Agassi. No other coach has matched his success, his dominance or his fame. His greatness, though, came at a terrible price - broken marriages, financial ruin and a fractured relationship with his surrogate son and most cherished student, Andre Agassi. This documentary tells his story and explores the cost of his all-consuming drive for greatness. Directed and produced by Jason Kohn.(n)

programme.title: The Sum of All Fears
programme.desc: Ben Affleck takes over the role of hero CIA agent Jack Ryan in this box office hit based on the best-selling novel by Tom Clancy. Low-level analyst Ryan is elevated to prominence by his expertise on an obscure strongman (Ciaran Hinds) after the politician's surprising ascendancy to the Russian presidency. But that's just the tip of a very large, very lethal iceberg involving neo-Nazis and a nuclear warhead smuggled into the U.S. by terrorists. Morgan Freeman, Bridget Moynihan and Liev Schreiber costar in this espionage adventure.(n)

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.(n)

Vik decides it’s time he started living for himself. But is he ready to face the consequences? Cole meets Nan, an old friend of his father’s, who sends him on a journey to exorcise the ghosts of his past.(n)

programme.title: Braveheart
programme.desc: In 1300 in Scotland William Wallace mounts a battle against the English King, a pagan usurper called Edward the Longshanks.(n)

programme.desc: Comedian Sacha Baron Cohen explores the diverse individuals, from the infamous to the unknown across the political and cultural spectrum, who populate our unique nation. Series premiere.(n)

programme.title: Frank Gallagher: Loving Husband, Devoted Father
programme.desc: Frank takes a big risk when two goons demand the six grand he owes them; Fiona agrees to a night away with Steve, leaving Liam in agoraphobic Sheila's care; Ian is fed up with Mickey's bullying of Kash and goes to do something about it, leading to a violent scene.(n)
